sub_title: Former Senior Accountant Specialist at EGI Foundation Amsterdam and Finance & Project Manager at Asia School of Business - by Central Bank of Malaysia (Bank Negara) & MIT Sloan Management
summary: Experienced Finance (Program/Project) Manager, Senior Consultant and Lecturer In Finance with a demonstrated history of working in the accounting and finance industry. Skilled in Microsoft Office in Excel, Powerpoint and Word, Oracle ERP, Factiva, Management, Mergers & Acquisitions, and Financial Accounting. Strong finance professional with a Master of Science (MSc) focused in Business Administration (Financial Management) from University of Twente. Currently reading law (Bachelor of Laws - LLB Program) from University of London.

profile_positions.description: Conducting online classes to local and international undergraduate and MBA students in Corporate Finance, Financial Accounting, Management/ Cost Accounting as part of the Financial Management subject or Basic Finance and Accounting.
profile_positions.title: Finance and Accounting Tutor

company.name: Asia School of Business - Bank Negara Malaysia & MIT Sloan School of Management

profile_positions.location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
profile_positions.company: Asia School of Business - Bank Negara Malaysia & MIT Sloan School of Management
profile_positions.description:
- Managing all financial matters of plantation & commodity projects i.e. cash flows, capital expenditures, financial planning & budgeting, forecasting & variance analysis and all other green finance activities in sustainability journey to achieving its respective United Nations Sustainable Development goals (SDGs).

- Executing (ad-hoc) financial performance reporting & analysis, financial modelling and decision support for focused scope within the respective projects i.e. re-investments, annual contracts, new hiring and etc. for long term sustainable economic activities.

- Preparing and managing financial records in Oracle - ERP accounting system on monthly closing, audit and taxations for responsible reporting.

- Active contribution in writing financial and asset management policies, business plans, proposals and reviewing legal documents i.e. MOA, MOU, NDA and Contracts for positive sustainable externalities.

- Monitoring and managing accounts receivables and payables of projects for proper management of funds.

- Partnering with both non-finance and finance personnel for achieving company/ project's United Nations SDGs.

- Liaising with other business units and partners on a range of matters and services.

- Other project management tasks i.e. HR, Legal and Asset Management

profile_positions.title: Assistant Manager Finance

company.name: Arnhem Business School - Hogeschool van Arnhem en Nijmegen (HAN)

profile_positions.description:
1. Taught at undergraduate level in areas of Financial Accounting, Management Accounting, Corporate Finance and Internship Preparation Class.
2. Act as a coach and supervisor to internship students in The Netherlands and abroad.
3. Contributed to the development and implementation of a high quality curriculum.
4. Developed learning materials and monitored students' progress, achievement and attendance.
5. Participated in the development, administration and marking of exams and other assessments.
6. Maintained own continuing professional development.

Courses:
(1) Basic Finance: Financial Accounting (Financial Statements) with a combination of Business Plan Project on Sales Forecast, Inventory or Procurement Planning, Cash Planning and Revenue Forecast.

(ii) Operational Control: Cost Accounting 
(Job Costing, ABC Costing, Budgeting, Product Mix Decisions with Microsoft Excel- Solver and etc.)

(iii) Tactical Control: Performance & Balanced Scorecard and Cost Allocations.

(iv) Short Term Financial Planning: Working Capital Management (BAT Model, Miller Orr, Evaluating Credit Policy with NPV, Inventory Management (EOQ Model, JIT, ABC Approach), International Trade Finance on Letter of Credit, Draft and Bill of Lading

(v) Corporate Finance: Time Value of Money, Discounted Cash Flow, CAPM, WACC.
profile_positions.title: Lecturer in Finance and Control

profile_positions.description: Built a financial model in excel as a forecasting tool for profitability in the future years. The financial model involved the knowledge application of cost accounting, Discounted Cash Flow (DCF) Model and Profits Method of real property appraisal. The valuation products were serviced offices, virtual offices and more.
profile_positions.title: Master Thesis Project

profile_positions.description:
Actively involved in corporate restructuring matters i.e. due diligence, working capital management, financial administrations, receiverships, liquidations and market research via OneSource & Factiva. Assigned to different assignments ranging from energy plant, manufacturing, real estate management and more.

(i) Represented the bank in the supervision and settlement of underperforming loans that concerned monitoring and controlling the operation of insolvent companies towards liquidity.
(ii) Hands-on experience in minimising credit risk, cash & revenue management, checking on employees’ payrolls and compensations, audit & taxation issues, loan restructuring and assets valuation.
(iii) Business writing i.e. preparation of business letters and information memorandum.
(iv) Reviewing legal documents,
(v) Detailed financial analysis, and 
(vi) Dealing with multiple external parties. For example, communicating with bankers for fund raising, CEOs for the understanding of the concerned insolvent business, lawyers for legal advice, valuers for asset valuation and media for press and advertising.
profile_positions.title: Senior Associate - Transaction Advisory Services (Corporate Restructuring)
